intro: Tacinga funalis subsp. atropurpurea, commonly known as the purple-fruited tacinga, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its simple, opposite, and often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Its fruits are follicles that turn a striking purple or reddish color when mature. It is native to parts of southern Africa and thrives in dry, rocky habitats.
